229A1F50DFE601316E4868A86D17958E.description: Integrate knowledge of dance, music, theatre, and visual arts and apply the arts to learning other disciplines
comments:
Examples of this include:
  • using visual arts skills to illustrate understanding of a story read in English language arts or foreign languages;
  • memorizing and singing American folk songs to enhance understanding of history and geography;
  • using short dance sequences to clarify concepts in mathematics.
For example, students examine a variety of percussion instruments, experiment with the different sounds they make, and learn about the cultures in which they were made.
229D9E10DFE601316E5368A86D17958E.description:
When using art materials or handling and viewing artifacts or musical instruments, ask and answer questions such as
  • "What is this made of?"
  • "How does this instrument produce sound?"
  • "Would I design this differently?"
  • "Who first thought of making something like this?"

229CDEE0DFE601316E5168A86D17958E.description: Perform or create works inspired by historical or cultural styles

229C8E30DFE601316E5068A86D17958E.description: Identify characteristic features of the visual arts of world civilizations such as styles of ancient Egypt and Africa, China, Mesopotamia, Greece, Rome, and the Medieval period in Europe

229C4760DFE601316E4F68A86D17958E.description:
Identify characteristic features of the performing and visual arts of native populations and immigrant groups to America, such as
  • styles of North American native cultures of the East Coast, Plains, Southwest, and Northwest;
  • styles of folk and fine arts of immigrant groups from European, African, Latin American, Asian, and Middle Eastern countries
comments: For example, students look at examples of Native American clay containers from the Southwest, and wooden containers from the Northwest and compare the similarities and differences in form and decoration.

229C0240DFE601316E4E68A86D17958E.description: Concepts of Style, Stylistic Influence, and Stylistic Change

229BBAC0DFE601316E4D68A86D17958E.description: Investigate how artists create their work; read about, view films about, or interview artists such as choreographers, dancers, composers, singers, instrumentalists, actors, storytellers, playwrights, illustrators, painters, sculptors, craftspeople, or architects
comments: For example, teachers invite an illustrator of children's books to school to show how she creates her illustrations.

229B2750DFE601316E4B68A86D17958E.description: Investigate uses and meanings of examples of the arts in children's daily lives, homes, and communities
comments: For example, children learn and teach other children songs in languages other than English; interview parents and community members about dances, songs, images, and stories that are part of their family and cultural heritage.

229ACEE0DFE601316E4A68A86D17958E.description: When viewing or listening to examples of visual arts, architecture, music, dance, storytelling, and theatre, ask and answer questions such as, "What is the artist trying to say?" "Who made this, and why?" "How does this work make me feel?"

229A7300DFE601316E4968A86D17958E.description: Purposes and Meanings in the Arts

22993770DFE601316E4568A86D17958E.description: Describe similarities and differences in works, and present personal responses to the subject matter, materials, techniques, and use of design elements in artworks

2298CDC0DFE601316E4468A86D17958E.description: Classify artworks into general categories, such as painting, printmaking, collage, sculpture, pottery, textiles, architecture, photography, and film

229862C0DFE601316E4368A86D17958E.description: In the course of making and viewing art, learn ways of discussing it, such as by making a list of all of the images seen in an artwork (visual inventory); and identifying kinds of color, line, texture, shapes, and forms in the work

2297D300DFE601316E4168A86D17958E.description: As a class, develop and use criteria for informal classroom discussions about art

22978A40DFE601316E4068A86D17958E.description: Select works for exhibition and work as a group to create a display

22973D20DFE601316E3F68A86D17958E.description: Select a work or works created during the year and discuss them with a parent, classmate, or teacher, explaining how the work was made, and why it was chosen for discussion
comments: For example, a first grader chooses a painting and tells how she mixed the colors, and talks about the decisions she made.

22969A90DFE601316E3D68A86D17958E.description: Create 2D and 3D artwork from memory or imagination to tell a story or embody an idea or fantasy
comments: For example, students draw members of a family from memory; illustrate a character in a folktale or play; build a clay model of an ideal place to play; or make images that convey ideas such as friendship.

22965020DFE601316E3C68A86D17958E.description: Create 2D and 3D expressive artwork that explores abstraction
comments: For example, a student simplifies an image by making decisions about essential colors, lines, or textures.

229604F0DFE601316E3B68A86D17958E.description: Create 2D and 3D artwork from direct observation
comments: For example, students draw a still life of flowers or fruit, action studies of their classmates in sports poses, or sketches of the class pet having a snack or a nap.

22955370DFE601316E3968A86D17958E.description:
For space and composition, explore composition by creating artwork with a center of interest, repetition, and/or balance
  • Demonstrate an understanding of foreground, middle ground, and background
  • Define and identify occurrences of balance, rhythm, repetition, variety, and emphasis

2294EED0DFE601316E3868A86D17958E.description:
For pattern and symmetry, explore the use of patterns and symmetrical shapes in 2D and 3D works
  • Identify patterns and symmetrical forms and shapes in the environment and artwork.
  • Explain and demonstrate ways in which patterns and symmetrical shapes may be made
comments: For example, a student folds and cuts paper to achieve symmetry, or makes printed patterns.

2294A360DFE601316E3768A86D17958E.description:
For shape and form, explore the use of shapes and forms in 2D and 3D works
  • Identify simple shapes of different sizes, for example, circles, squares, triangles, and forms, for example, spheres, cones, cubes, in the environment and in artwork

22945C30DFE601316E3668A86D17958E.description:
For texture, explore the use of textures in 2D and 3D works
  • Identify a wide variety of types of textures, for example, smooth, rough, and bumpy, in the environment and in artwork
  • Create representations of textures in drawings, paintings, rubbings, or relief

22941660DFE601316E3568A86D17958E.description:
For line, explore the use of line in 2D and 3D works
  • Identify a wide variety of types of lines in the environment and in artwork
comments: For example, students take a walk around the school and note jagged, straight, curved, thick, and thin lines.

2293CEB0DFE601316E3468A86D17958E.description:
For color, explore and experiment with the use of color in dry and wet media
  • Identify primary and secondary colors and gradations of black, white and gray in the environment and artwork
  • Explore how color can convey mood and emotion
comments: For example, students mix light and dark values of colors or predict the results of overlapping and blending primary colors.

22931850DFE601316E3268A86D17958E.description: Learn to take care of materials and tools and to use them safely

2292AE20DFE601316E3168A86D17958E.description: Learn and use appropriate vocabulary related to methods, materials, and techniques

229264E0DFE601316E3068A86D17958E.description: Create artwork in a variety of two-dimensional (2D) and three-dimensional (3D) media, for example: 2D – drawing, painting, collage, printmaking, weaving; 3D – plastic (malleable) materials such as clay and paper, wood, or found objects for assemblage and construction

22921C50DFE601316E2F68A86D17958E.description: Use a variety of materials and media, for example, crayons, chalk, paint, clay, various kinds of papers, textiles, and yarns, and understand how to use them to produce different visual effects

2290FA40DFE601316E2C68A86D17958E.description: Give and accept constructive and supportive feedback

2290AC40DFE601316E2B68A86D17958E.description: Analyze and describe strengths and weakness of their own work (grades 3 and 4 only)

22905390DFE601316E2A68A86D17958E.description: Articulate reasons for particular emotional responses to and personal preferences about classroom dramatizations and dramatic performances

228FFFA0DFE601316E2968A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe the visual, aural, oral, and kinetic details of classroom dramatizations and dramatic performances

228F9A70DFE601316E2868A86D17958E.description: Describe and demonstrate audience skills of observing attentively and responding appropriately in classroom presentations, rehearsals, and live performance settings

228F0BE0DFE601316E2668A86D17958E.description: Visualize environments and arrange the physical playing space to communicate mood, time, and locale

228EC400DFE601316E2568A86D17958E.description: Collect, make, or borrow materials that could be used for scenery, properties (props), costumes, sound effects, and lighting for informal classroom presentations

228E2C70DFE601316E2368A86D17958E.description: In creating and rehearsing informal classroom dramatizations, experiment with and make decisions about the visual configuration of the acting space (e.g., actors' exits, entrances, placement of set pieces, and the location of the audience)

228D8350DFE601316E2168A86D17958E.description: Plan, improvise, and write or record simple dramas that include the "five w's": who, what, where, when, and why

228D2050DFE601316E2068A86D17958E.description: Create a scene or play with a beginning, middle, and end based on an original idea, a story, or other forms of literature (fiction, nonfiction, poetry)

228CCE10DFE601316E1F68A86D17958E.description: Develop dramatic dialogue for characters from a folktale told in prose

228C6E30DFE601316E1E68A86D17958E.description: Read plays and stories and identify characters, setting, and action

228C2810DFE601316E1D68A86D17958E.description: Identify what drama is and how it happens

228B99F0DFE601316E1B68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to work effectively alone and cooperatively with a partner or in an ensemble

228B5500DFE601316E1A68A86D17958E.description: Learn lines, observe, listen, and respond in character to other actors

228B0D60DFE601316E1968A86D17958E.description: Create characters through physical movement, gesture, sound and/or speech, and facial expression

228AC150DFE601316E1868A86D17958E.description: Pretend to be someone else, creating a character based on stories or through improvisation, using properties (props), costumes, and imagery

228A6FB0DFE601316E1768A86D17958E.description: Imagine and clearly describe characters, their relationships, setting, conflict, and plot from a variety of appropriate literature

228A2900DFE601316E1668A86D17958E.description: Read, listen to, and tell stories from a variety of cultures, genres, and styles

22895070DFE601316E1368A86D17958E.description: Describe and demonstrate audience skills of listening attentively and responding appropriately in classroom, rehearsal, and performance settings

2288F8D0DFE601316E1268A86D17958E.description: Respond through purposeful movement to selected prominent music characteristics or to specific music occurrences while singing or listening to music

22889780DFE601316E1168A86D17958E.description: Identify the sounds of a variety of instruments, including many orchestra and band instruments, and instruments from various cultures, as well as children's voices and male and female adult voices

22883E60DFE601316E1068A86D17958E.description: Use appropriate terminology in describing music, music notation, music instruments and voices, and music performances

2287D6F0DFE601316E0F68A86D17958E.description: Listen to and describe aural examples of music of various styles, genres, cultural and historical periods, identifying expressive qualities, instrumentation, and cultural and/or geographic context

22877C80DFE601316E0E68A86D17958E.description: Perceive, describe, and respond to basic elements of music, including beat, tempo, rhythm, meter, pitch, melody, texture, dynamics, harmony, and form

2286CE30DFE601316E0C68A86D17958E.description: Create and arrange short songs and instrumental pieces within teacher-specified guidelines

22867330DFE601316E0B68A86D17958E.description: Improvise and compose short vocal and instrumental melodies, using a variety of sound sources, including traditional sounds, nontraditional sounds available in the classroom, body sounds (such as clapping), and sounds produced by electronic means

22862A60DFE601316E0A68A86D17958E.description: Improvise and compose simple rhythmic variations and simple melodic embellishments on familiar melodies

2285E1A0DFE601316E0968A86D17958E.description: Improvise and compose simple rhythmic and melodic ostinato accompaniments

228598E0DFE601316E0868A86D17958E.description: Improvise "answers" in the same style to given rhythmic and melodic phrases

2284F5F0DFE601316E0668A86D17958E.description: Perform independent instrumental parts while other students sing or play contrasting parts

2284B0C0DFE601316E0568A86D17958E.description: Perform in groups, blending instrumental timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor

22846B00DFE601316E0468A86D17958E.description: Echo and perform easy rhythmic, melodic, and chordal patterns accurately and independently on rhythmic, melodic, and harmonic classroom instruments

22842470DFE601316E0368A86D17958E.description: Play from memory and written notation a varied repertoire representing genres and styles from diverse cultures and historical periods

2283CCE0DFE601316E0268A86D17958E.description: Play expressively with appropriate dynamics, phrasing and articulation, and interpretation

22837660DFE601316E0168A86D17958E.description: Play independently with accurate intonation, steady tempo, rhythmic accuracy, appropriate technique, and correct posture

2282CE80DFE601316DFF68A86D17958E.description: Use standard symbols to notate meter, rhythm, pitch, and dynamics in simple patterns performed by the teacher

22827A00DFE601316DFE68A86D17958E.description: Identify symbols and traditional terms referring to dynamics, tempo, and articulation and interpret them correctly when performing

22822070DFE601316DFD68A86D17958E.description: Use a system (syllables, numbers, or letters) to read and sing at sight simple pitch notation in the treble clef

2281B3E0DFE601316DFC68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate and respond to: the beat, division of the beat, meter (2/4, 3/4, 4/4), and rhythmic notation, including half, quarter, eighth, and sixteenth notes and rests

22811590DFE601316DFA68A86D17958E.description: Sing in groups, blending vocal timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor

2280CC70DFE601316DF968A86D17958E.description: Sing ostinatos, partner songs, rounds and simple two-part songs, with and without accompaniment

228081D0DFE601316DF868A86D17958E.description: Sing from memory a variety of songs representing genres and styles from diverse cultures and historical periods

228038F0DFE601316DF768A86D17958E.description: Sing expressively with appropriate dynamics, phrasing, and interpretation

227FEA80DFE601316DF668A86D17958E.description: Sing independently, maintaining accurate intonation, steady tempo, rhythmic accuracy, appropriately-produced sound (timbre), clear diction, and correct posture

227EFC70DFE601316DF368A86D17958E.description: Describe and demonstrate audience skills of observing attentively and responding appropriately in classroom, rehearsal, and performance settings

227E9770DFE601316DF268A86D17958E.description: Observe two dances and discuss how they are similar and different, considering use of theme, space, timing and rhythms, gestures and body language, properties (props), costumes, etc.

227E3BB0DFE601316DF168A86D17958E.description: Explore, discover, and realize multiple solutions to a given movement problem. Reflect upon the uniqueness of each solution

227DD790DFE601316DF068A86D17958E.description: Observe dances from a variety of cultures and describe their movements

227D4E60DFE601316DEE68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to work effectively with a group or leader

227D0820DFE601316DED68A86D17958E.description: Create original dances or themes for movement improvisations, or learn traditional dances; rehearse, and demonstrate dances, making decisions about the performance space, audience location, entrances and exits, and costumes

227CBE70DFE601316DEC68A86D17958E.description: Describe the role of traditional and nontraditional dances and the circumstances and settings in which these dances would be performed

227BF770DFE601316DEA68A86D17958E.description: Present dances or movement phrases and discuss how movement choices convey meaning

227BAF90DFE601316DE968A86D17958E.description: Present dances or movement phrases; identify and describe movement choices and discuss varied responses to them

227B6960DFE601316DE868A86D17958E.description: Observe and discuss how dance performance is different from other forms of human movement used in sports, everyday gestures, or social dancing

227B21C0DFE601316DE768A86D17958E.description: Observe, explore, and discuss how movements can show feelings, images, thoughts, colors, sounds, and textures

227A9210DFE601316DE568A86D17958E.description: Explore movement using a variety of available objects, properties (props), fabrics, and clothing pieces, etc.

227A4260DFE601316DE468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to work effectively alone, with a partner, and in an ensemble

2279F980DFE601316DE368A86D17958E.description: Create a dance phrase and then vary it, making changes in space, time, and energy/force

22799EF0DFE601316DE268A86D17958E.description: Create a dance phrase with a beginning, middle, and end; be able to repeat it, with or without music

22794970DFE601316DE168A86D17958E.description: Explore and invent movement, and improvise to solve movement problems

22788BF0DFE601316DDF68A86D17958E.description: Develop and value a positive body image

22784830DFE601316DDE68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate accuracy in memorizing and reproducing simple movement phrases and folk dances

22780310DFE601316DDD68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate ability to work in a group to learn and perform sequences of movement and simple dances

2277BE40DFE601316DDC68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate partner skills of copying, leading, following, and mirror imaging

comments: students explore changing shapes; moving at different levels, speeds, and directions; and changing dynamics such as strong/light, sudden/sustained, or direct/indirect.
227771C0DFE601316DDB68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and explore space, time, and force as three elements of movement and dance

22771E60DFE601316DDA68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to define and maintain personal space

2276B150DFE601316DD968A86D17958E.description: Identify and demonstrate accuracy in moving to a musical beat and responding to changes in tempo

22765FB0DFE601316DD868A86D17958E.description: Develop strength, flexibility, balance, and neuromuscular coordination

22760780DFE601316DD768A86D17958E.description: Identify and demonstrate basic locomotor and non-locomotor movements
